results.title: News reports from France. [No. 72/80] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Germaine Richier 1904-1959, French sculptor - by Yves Allain, Jean-Claude Maillet. 2. Lille Roubaix Tourcoing by Carlos Vilardebo - a town in France and its industries. 3. Ars Antica by Jacques Scandelari - a music group play music spanning five centuries. 4. Le Maire de Douelle. Dans le depart ement du lot by Jacques Scandelari - about the Mayor of the town.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 72/79] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. Folon - Jean-Michel Folon, black and white and watercolor artist famous for his covers on international magazines and his posters. 2. A day in a schoolteacher’s life - Jean-Michel Taillon, a French grade school teacher. 3. Stones - Stones, marvels among minerals, most of the time concealed in the bowels of the earth or beneath the roar of the waves. 4. Jacques Douai - Portrait of French songster Jacques Douai.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 71/76] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. Helen of Troy at Avignon - Avignon, August 1971: restaging of “The Trojan War will not take place”, by Jean Giraudoux. 2. The Opera Dancing School and Degas - Painter and sculptor Degas and his favourite models. 3. The preservation of nature: III Annecy Lake - Pollution threatened one of the most beautiful of Alpine lakes. It will only survive if the delicate biological equilibrium is maintained. 4. Georges Brassens - A portrait of the famous singer-poet.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 71/65] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Bread of French tradition - Breadmaking process from wheat harvest to baking in France. 2. Discovering science - Palais de la Decouverte in Paris. 3. Iannis Xenakis - A brilliant modern composer and musician.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 71/61] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. The Cathedral of Chartres - 2,500,000 visitors still come each year to hail Our Lady of Chartres. 2. The circus - A glimpse of France’s circuses (no commentary). 3. Archaelogical discoveries: Susa, Persia - At the close of the 6th century BC the Persian Empire extended from the Mediterranean all the way to the Indus river. Its administrative capital was the city of Susa. Today, a French crew of archaeologists is discovering its buried treasures.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 71/60] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. “L’Apocalypse der Jean” - Joseph Foret of Paris puts together a huge tome on St John’s writing illustrated by seven artists and a calligrapher. 2. “Rimbaud et Charleville” - life of Rimbaud the great French poet.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 70?/16] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. A century of the restoration of historical monuments - about Prosper Merimee who, as Inspector General of French Historical Monuments began the work of restoring France’s historical buildings and monuments. 2. The audiovisual era - a science fair showing new audiovisual techniques and machines such as a multiple choice machine for exams and one for teaching dentistry. 3. Trade Unionism in France - shows the history of trade unionism in France and the cooperation between unions, management and the government. Shows how it works in the Renault factory.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 70/59] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. La Rochelle - La Rochelle, 70,000 inhabitants, trade and fishing port, tourist resort, on the Atlantic coast. 2. Claude Nougaro - Annecy, one spring evening…a halt in Claude Nougaro’s singing tour. 3. France and the horse - In our mechanical universe, the horse brings us back to nature. 4. The charm of the Palais Royal - In the heart of Paris, between the Opera and the Louvre, an oasis of peace and haven of silence, the garden of the Palais Royal.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 60/56] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Aix-En-Provence - Takes us through the history of the picturesque town which is a bastion of European culture. 2. Christine Caron - The story of champion swimmer who becomes a singer and movie performer. 3. Le Sologne du Grand Meaulnes - Background to the writing of a famous French novel about adolescent love. 4. Cesar - A French sculptor who went from sculpting marble to working with junkyard metal scraps.
